verses.verse: From: Paul (a missionary not out from people, nor through a person, but through Jesus, the Anointed King, and through Father God, the One who got Him up from the dead)
and all the brothers together with me. To: the assemblies of Galatia.
Generosity to you and peace out from Father God and our Master Jesus, the Anointed King,
the One who gave Himself on behalf of our sins in order that He might take us out of the evil span of time that has stood here, in line with what our God and Father wants,
to whom the magnificence belongs for the spans of time of the spans of time. Amen.
I am amazed that this is how quickly you are transferred away from the One who invited you in generosity (the Anointed King) to different good news,
that is not other good news except there are some people agitating you and wanting to alter the good news of the Anointed King.
But even if we or an angel from heaven should share good news with you contrary to what we shared with you, he must be doomed.
As we have stated before, even now I say again, "If anyone shares good news with you contrary to what you received in, he must be doomed."
You see, do I now persuade people or God? Or do I look to be satisfying people? You see, if I were still satisfying people, I would not be a slave of the Anointed King.
I am making the good news known to you, brothers, the good news that was shared by me, that it is not according to a person;
for I neither received it in from the side of a person, nor was taught it, but I got it through the thing uncovered to me, Jesus, the Anointed King.
You see, you heard of my behavior in the past in Judaism, that even more than others I was pursuing the assembly of God and damaging it,
and I was progressing in Judaism above many my own age in my family being a person with much more passion for my patrimonial traditions.
But when it seemed like a good idea to God (the One who isolated me from my mother's belly and invited me through His generosity)
to uncover His Son in me so that I may share the good news of Him among the non-Jews, I didn't consult right away with a physical body and blood.
Neither did I go up into Jerusalem to the missionaries before me. But I went off into Arabia and returned again into Damascus.
Following that, after three years, I went up into Jerusalem to visit Peter. And I stayed over for fifteen days close to him.
But a different one of the missionaries I didn't see except James, the brother of the Master
(the things that I am writing to you, look in the sight of God that I am not lying).
Following that, I went to the slopes of Syria and Cilicia.
I was a person that no one was aware of by the face in the assemblies of Judea, the assemblies in the Anointed King.
There were people only hearing, "The one pursuing us in the past, now shares the good news of the trust that in the past he was damaging,"
and in me they were admitting that God is magnificent.
